metadata.title: CVE-2016-9373 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In Wireshark 2.2.0 to 2.2.1 and 2.0.0 to 2.0.7, the DCERPC dissector couldcrash with a use-after-free, triggered by network traffic or a capturefile. This was addressed in epan/dissectors/packet-dcerpc-nt.c andepan/dissectors/packet-dcerpc-spoolss.c by using the wmem file scope forprivate strings.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9373` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1
libwireshark5 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1
libwiretap4 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1
libwsutil4 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1
tshark - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1
wireshark - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1
wireshark-common - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1
wireshark-qt - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1').
